avalancheActivity.comment: The main danger spots are smaller, fresh accumulations of wind drifted snow in the north, east and south sectors. Smaller slab avalanches can be triggered behind terrain edges and in entrances to gullies and bowls by even a small additional load. In some places, avalanches can tear through weak layers of old snow close to the ground and reach medium-sized dimensions.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Beware of fresh wind-drifted snow at high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: Older wind drifted snow in the northern and eastern sectors of the high altitudes is largely stable. By Friday additional smaller, fresh and partly unstable accumulations of wind drifted snow will form in the extended eastern sector. Below this, a succession of crusts and softer layers will form an increasingly unstable snow layering in the higher altitudes.

tendency.highlights: Sunny and cold mountain weather is expected on Saturday. The avalanche danger remains unchanged.

weatherForecast.comment: During the night to Friday, a cold front will cause a strong drop in temperatures and extremely stormy north-westerly winds in the Styrian mountains. The snowfall level will drop down to the valleys. In the Niedere Tauern and the northern Kalkalpen (Dachsteingebirge to Hochschwab), 5 to 15 cm of fresh snow is expected. From the morning hours onwards, the snowfall will subside and retreat to the Nordstau region. At the same time, the wind will turn more and more to the north. It will remain stormy in the east of Styria. Mostly sunny conditions are expected from midday, but the winds will continue to blow strongly. Temperatures at an altitude of 2000 m will be a wintry -10 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. Dangerous spots occur sporadically in the form of fresh snowdrift deposits. These are located in high entrances to gullies and bowls, especially in eastern exposures. Small slab avalanches can be triggered here in wind drifted snow by even a low additional load. In addition to the danger of burying, the risk of being swept away and falling should also be taken into account.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger - only isolated danger spots due to fresh wind drifted snow.

snowpackStructure.comment: Older wind drifted snow in the northern and eastern sectors of the high altitudes is largely stable. By Friday, additional small snowdrift deposites will form in the extended eastern sector. At higher altitudes, a succession of crusts and softer layers will form under these snowdirft deposites, creating a somewhat unstable snow layering. At medium and lower altitudes as well as on sunny slopes, the fresh snow lies directly on the previously porous base.

tendency.highlights: Sunny and cold mountain weather is expected on Saturday. The avalanche danger remains unchanged.

weatherForecast.comment: During the night to Friday, a cold front will bring a significant drop in temperatures and stormy north-westerly winds in the Styrian mountains. The snow line will drop down into the valleys, but the snowfall will remain low overall. The snowfall will decrease from the morning hours onwards, while the winds will shift to the north. It will only remain stormy in the east of Styria. From midday, mainly sunny conditions are expected. The wind will remain strong and temperatures at an altitude of 2000 m will be a winterly -10 degrees.

customData.generalHeadline: Storm and some fresh wind-drifted snow i the high altitudes!
